Sawaddee ka welcome to hot thai kitchen today we 
are making yet another quick and simple dinner but

this one is also very versatile you can turn 
it into all sorts of things we are making in

English what's called garlic pepper chicken I 
know the name sells good already right in Thai

it's called gai pad gratiem and gai is chicken Pad 
means to stir-fry and gratiem is garlic I guess
you can also call it phrikthiy and phrikthiy is pepper so it's very easy let's look

at our ingredients so here's our chicken I'm using 
chicken breasts today you can use chicken thighs

this will even work with pork and just cut them 
into bite-sized pieces but don't go too thin right

we're using chicken breasts and always always if 
you cut chicken breasts too thin you give yourself

a very small margin of cooking before the chicken 
dries out so you want it about about a centimeter

you know something like something a little 
substantial in me and then you're just going to

put all the sauces that we talked about into the 
chicken oyster sauce fish sauce what is this soy

sauce golden mountain sauce which is another type 
of soy sauce you can't find it just substitute

another kind of soy sauce are you wondering do I 
really need all those sauces and you don't but I

like to use all these combinations because each 
sauce has a different flavor and you know they

contribute something different so the flavors a 
little more complex but if all you had is oyster

sauce and soy sauce that's perfectly fine okay 
and then our pepper I like to use a combination

of black and white you may have noticed that 
already just give that a good stir now I'm also

going to give you an optional ingredient which 
is somewhere over there black soy sauce which

is just going to give our chicken a darker color 
it's not absolutely necessary this is not salty

it's a little bit sweet but we're just going to 
add just enough to get some nice color going so

you don't need to let this marinate for any you 
know four hours or anything just mix it while

you do other things and it'll be ready by the time 
you're ready to use it so set that aside and then

the most important part of this ingredient I mean 
of this recipe is the garlic we're using a lot of

garlic eight cloves of garlic which is almost an 
entire head you could go with an entire head if

you want we're going to fry it until it's golden 
and crispy so you make sure you want to chop them

quite finely but not too fine or they'll burn 
too quickly okay so just something like that and

that's all our prep really let's go and cook so 
we're first going to make our fried garlic crispy

fried garlic I made this before once in my glass 
noodle soup video it was the same thing okay so

I've got all my garlic I'm going to put it in 
and there's a little bit of oil in there you

don't want to preheat the oil too hot because you 
want the garlic to have time to crisp up without

burning so I'm going to keep the heat quite low at 
this point so you just want slow low simmering if

you can simmer in oil I'm going to add a little 
bit more oil so I've got plenty of oil to cover

the garlic yeah that looks good so we're going 
to have end up with a little bit more oil than

we need but the rest of it is good on anything 
it'll be like super garlicky oil okay so I'm

going to let that go stir it every once in a while 
and it's going to take about five five to seven

minutes depending on your heat and what you're 
looking for is for the garlic to be golden brown

and crispy so very close now so you want to pay 
attention don't walk away at this point because

once they burn they become quite bitter and it 
doesn't take burning to get them bitter it just

takes being too dark to get them bitter so you 
just wanna light golden brown keep the heat low

so ideally you want the bubbles to be completely 
stopped by the time the color is correct because

that means your garlic is crispy if you don't care 
too much about it being completely crispy then

it's not you don't have to wait for the bubbles to 
all be gone because half of that garlic is going

to get tossed in with the chicken so they won't 
be crispy anyway but I like to keep some crispy

bits to sprinkle on top it's a nice touch mmm 
smells so good okay I'm pretty happy with this

I could push it a little bit further but I think 
this is okay so because it's going to darken a

little bit acet six there as well so I just got 
some large chunks that are bubbling but most of

them are pretty still now if you can see so I'm 
going to take it off and then strain it you want

to save the oil since we're going to use all that 
garlicky oil to cook our chicken but you want to

separate the garlic from the oil so the garlic 
can chill out dry off and become crispy that's

it now if you want to make extra and save this 
so you can have it for miscellaneous sprinklings

go for it so this is going to go very quickly as 
per all star fries make sure all your meson flouse

is right around you at arm's reach so here's our 
garlic oil mmm I'm going to add it to the pan not

all of it you might end up with more that's okay 
and I'm going to add the rest to my chicken and

I do this just so that to lubricate the chicken a 
little bit so that the chicken has an easier time

separating when it goes into the wok as you know 
we've all done that where you put in a bunch of

meat and then they're all sticking together and 
they won't separate on those final two pieces

anyway so this helps a little lubrication okay 
so when the pan is hot go in with your chicken

and toss it quickly your sugar and now all you 
have to do is stir it till it's done our stove

is not very hot so as for any stir-fry always 
have a little bit of water handy you may or may

not need it depending on the heat of your stove 
or the amount of sauce that you want but if you

find that oh the pan is too hot the chicken is 
sticking a little bit or whatever reason or you

want more sauce you can add a little splash so 
it's always always handy to have water on hand

now for this particular one I don't actually 
like a lot of sauce I like it pretty tight so

that the chicken itself is is flavorful so none 
of the sauces on the bottom of your plate it's

all in the chicken but if you like it thing's 
saucy you can add water and then you may need

to up your sauce measurements a little bit to 
get that to get the same level of seasoning and

as the chicken sick it will also release some 
more sauce so it looks dry in the pan there's

always after you plated it there's always still 
soft coming out in the end see how quick that was

where all is done now if you want your chickens 
will be a little darker a splash of dark soy will

do the trick okay so the chicken is pretty much 
done so what I'm going to do now is I'm going

to go in with half of my fried garlic get that 
garlic flavor distributed and also my chopped

cilantro stems i finely chopped it for that extra 
cilantro flavor if you don't like cilantro you can

do green onions if you want and I use the stem 
for two reasons one it's more fragrant than the

leaves - it won't turn black the way leaves will 
so to look nice there you go turn it off yeah

we're done there see I was saying that this stuff 
is super versatile because you can add vegetables

to this you can put this in the chicken wrap 
you can I've had this with scrambled eggs in

the morning put it in an omelet I mean garlic 
pepper chick garlic pepper anything is good so

and see I don't know if you can see but there's 
already quite a bit of sauce that's come out from

the chicken because it's been sitting a little 
bit okay okay so and then finally our final

touch our crispy garlic is just gonna go on top 
see how when we use the cilantro stems it's not

you don't have Bruce leaves all over the place oh
